body_html: FYI, I got the same segfault running a python interpreter following this tutorial. The tutorial suggests we call .creator, which has been replaced with .grad_fn . I called .grad_fn() out of curiousity, and -> segfault.
body_text: FYI, I got the same segfault running a python interpreter following this tutorial. The tutorial suggests we call .creator, which has been replaced with .grad_fn .  I called .grad_fn() out of curiousity, and -> segfault.
body: FYI, I got the same segfault running a python interpreter following this [tutorial](https://hsaghir.github.io/data_science/pytorch_starter/). The tutorial suggests we call `.creator`, which has been [replaced](https://github.com/pytorch/tutorials/pull/91/files) with `.grad_fn` .  I called `.grad_fn()` out of curiousity, and -> segfault.
